label: logicC:chemistry_en
steps: [1] If hydrochloric acid is added to sodium carbonate solution, carbon dioxide gas evolves.
[2] If carbon dioxide is produced, bubbling it through limewater turns the limewater milky.
[3] If limewater turns milky and the milkiness later clears on continued CO2 flow, the gas is confirmed as carbon dioxide.
[4] On continued passage of the gas, the limewater’s milkiness clears.
[5] Hydrochloric acid is added to sodium carbonate solution.
[6] For any substance x, if x is a Brønsted acid, then x donates a proton in water.
[7] Substance a (acetic acid) is a Brønsted acid.
[8] For any substance x, if x donates a proton in water, then x either lowers the pH or effervesces with carbonate to release CO2.
[11] The gas is confirmed as carbon dioxide. (from [3] and [10] and [4])
[12] a donates a proton and either lowers the pH or effervesces with carbonate to release CO2. (from [6],[7],[8])
